alert.note: Alert for Caledonia; Essex; Lamoille; Orleans (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 08 at 8:32PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Lamoille, Caledonia, eastern Orleans and Essex Counties through 930 PM EDT... At 830 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over East Haven, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Heavy rainfall associated with a cluster of thunderstorms has led to over an inch of rainfall in the last hour. Additional rainfall is likely over the next hour with up to another inch of rainfall possible. Localized flooding is possible in low-lying areas and in small creeks and streams. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Localized flooding from heavy rainfall could some small creeks and streams to come out of their banks. Low-lying areas will also be susceptible to flooding. Please do not drive through flooded roadways. Locations impacted include... St. Johnsbury, Island Pond, Lyndon, Greensboro, Charleston, Waterford, Westmore, Stannard, Orleans Village, Glover, Hardwick, Brownington, Burke, Brunswick, Sutton, Lunenburg, Barton, Greensboro Bend, Averill, and Sheffield. This includes the following highways... Interstate 91 between mile markers 128 and 161. Interstate 93 between mile markers 1 and 11. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
